@graph.rdfs:comment: Datasets contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. A dataset is a collection of data of a particular experimental type. The NIAID Data Ecosystem is an environment to find and access and infectious and immune-mediated disease data and computational tools to speed the development of diagnostics, therapeutics, and vaccines. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.
@graph.abstract: Datasets contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. A dataset is a collection of data of a particular experimental type.
@graph.rdfs:label: Dataset

citedBy.description: Publications, datasets, or computational tools that cite the work.

date.description: Date the work has changed: most recent date of dateModified, datePublished, and dateCreated.

doi.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the work, not any associated publications.

isRelatedTo.description: Datasets which are related to the given dataset; often datasets involved in the same study. These linkages are created via human curation.

isSimilarTo.description: Datasets or computational tools which are similar to the work, based on terms in the names, descriptions, authors, measurementTechniques, infectiousAgents, healthConditions, etc.

isBasisFor.description: A dataset which reuses the dataset.

nctid.description: ClinicalTrials.gov identifier associated with the dataset.

relationship.description: How an associated work is related to the dataset.

topicCategory.description: Topic of the work. This topic may be assigned by a human curator or through automated algorithms.

infectiousAgent.description: Infectious agent(s) / pathogen(s) which are the focus of the work (like SARS-CoV-2).

anyOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

healthCondition.description: The health condition(s) /infectious disease(s) which are the focus of the work (like COVID-19, coronavirus).

anyOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

funding.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this dataset through some kind of financial contribution.

oneOf.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this dataset through some kind of financial contribution

funder.description: An organization associated with a creator or funder of a dataset

name.description: An organization associated with a creator or funder of a dataset

parentOrganization.description: name of the parent funding organization

items.description: Information about a single funder

name.description: An organization associated with a creator or funder of a dataset

parentOrganization.description: name of the parent funding organization

description.description: description about the funding award / grant

identifier.description: Unique identifier(s) for the grant(s) used to fund the Dataset

items.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this dataset through some kind of financial contribution

funder.description: An organization associated with a creator or funder of a dataset

name.description: An organization associated with a creator or funder of a dataset

parentOrganization.description: name of the parent funding organization

items.description: Information about a single funder

name.description: An organization associated with a creator or funder of a dataset

parentOrganization.description: name of the parent funding organization

description.description: description about the funding award / grant

identifier.description: Unique identifier(s) for the grant(s) used to fund the Dataset

species.description: Species / host organism from which the dataset has been collected.

anyOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

distribution.description: A downloadable form of this dataset, at a specific location, in a specific format.

items.description: A dataset in downloadable form.

includedInDataCatalog.description: Data or tool catalog where the work is published; original source of the metadata.

measurementTechnique.description: A technique or technology used in a  dataset corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (described using variableMeasured). For example, if variableMeasured is molecule concentration, measurementTechnique could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence".
measurementTechnique.abstract: measurement technique used to collect the dataset

anyOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

abstract.description: Short description that summarizes a work.

aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the work. These ratings can be collected based on user reviews or through Altmetric scores of web-based citations.

author.description: Author or creator of the work.

citation.description: A citation or reference to a publication, dataset, or computational tool which uses the dataset. Examples: a publication which describes the collection/analysis of the dataset, a publication which reuses the dataset in a secondary analysis, a dataset which extends the existing dataset, or a computational tool which relies on the dataset.

conditionsOfAccess.description: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, the work. Options include open (freely available), restricted (may include restrictions such as on use), closed (requires registration to access), or embargoed (unpublished).

creator.description: The creator/author of this work; equivalent to author

datePublished.description: Date the work was first published

hasPart.description: Associated materials for the dataset, including data dictionaries and data limitation descriptions

inLanguage.description: The language of the content of the dataset

interactionStatistic.description: The number of interactions with the work, such as page views or tool downloads.

isAccessibleForFree.description: A flag to signal that the work is accessible for free.

isBasedOn.description: A dataset, publication, or computational tool from which this work is derived, modified, or adapted.
isBasedOn.abstract: dataset, publication, or tool used to create the work

isPartOf.description: Indicates a broader study, project, or collection the work is part of.
isPartOf.abstract: study or project including the work

keywords.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this work.

license.description: A license document that applies to this work, typically indicated by URL.

sdPublisher.description: Original publisher of the dataset metadata (like GenBank, ImmPort, etc.)

spatialCoverage.description: The place(s) which are the focus of the dataset

items.description: Location information

administrativeType.description: the type of administrative area, such as country, state, county, or city

identifier.description: An identifier for the location, preferably a Wikidata ID

locationType.description: Categorization of how the location relates to the dataset

administrativeType.description: the type of administrative area, such as country, state, county, or city

identifier.description: An identifier for the location, preferably a Wikidata ID

locationType.description: Categorization of how the location relates to the dataset

temporalCoverage.description: The period of time covered within the dataset.

items.description: Temporal information

duration.description: A time interval in ISO 8601 duration format

temporalType.description: Categorization of how the date/temporal interval relates to the dataset

duration.description: A time interval in ISO 8601 duration format

temporalType.description: Categorization of how the date/temporal interval relates to the dataset

usageInfo.description: Data usage agreement, specifying the terms under which the dataset can be used. Note that this is related to but distinct from the license.

alternateName.description: An alias for the dataset name.

identifier.description: Dataset identifier or accession number, such as a digital object identifier (DOI), sequence read archive (SRA) or GenBank accession number, etc.

mainEntityOfPage.description: Website which describes the work and provides additional details.

sameAs.description: URL of additional sources for the work.

citation.description: A citation object for a resource which is cited by the dataset (ie- is a derivative of the dataset) , related to the dataset, or from which the dataset was based on (ie- is derived from).

identifier.description: An identifier associated with the citation such as a digital object identifier (DOI), PubMed ID (PMID), or PubMed Central ID (PMCID)

pmid.description: A PubMed identifier (PMID) of the referenced publication

doi.description: A digital object identifier (DOI) of the referenced publication

issueNumber.description: Issue number where the article appears

journalNameAbbrev.description: Abbreviated journal name where the article appears

pagination.description: Page numbers in the journal where the article appears

volumeNumber.description: Volume of the journal where the article appears

citation.description: The bibliographic citation string for the article as is provided

datePublished.description: Date the referenced work was published

includedInDataCatalog.description: Data or tool catalog which houses the work

identifier.description: An identifier associated with the work

doi.description: A digital object identifier (DOI) of the referenced work

citation.description: The bibliographic citation for the referenced work as is provided

url.description: Link to data or tool catalog

versionDate.description: date the metadata was harvested from the catalog

name.description: Name of the affiliation, such as a university

parentOrganization.description: Name of the parent organization. For instance, the parentOrganization of NIAID is the National Institutes of health (NIH)

identifier.description: Unique identifier of the organization

role.description: What role the organization played in creating the dataset

name.description: Name of the affiliation, such as a university

identifier.description: Unique identifier of the person, like an ORCID ID

role.description: Role the person played in creating the dataset

url.description: Link to the homepage or other web content describing the person

identifier.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

curatedBy.description: The person, organization, or catalog that curated this DefinedTerm for the metadata property

termCode.description: A code that identifies this DefinedTerm within a DefinedTermSet.

inDefinedTermSet.description: A DefinedTermSet that contains this term.

originalName.description: The original name of the item, before any metadata standardization/normalization

isCurated.description: A boolean indicator describing whether or not this DefinedTerm was curated as the value of a property.

@graph.rdfs:comment: ComputationalTools (software, workflows, computational tools, code) contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. The NIAID Data Ecosystem is a secure environment to find, access and analyze immune-mediated and infectious disease data and computational tools to speed the development of diagnostics, therapeutics, and vaccines. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.
@graph.rdfs:label: ComputationalTool

citedBy.description: Publications, datasets, or computational tools that cite the work.

date.description: Date the work has changed: most recent date of dateModified, datePublished, and dateCreated.

doi.description: Digital object identifier (DOI) for the work, not any associated publications

includedInDataCatalog.description: Data or tool catalog where the work is published; original source of the metadata.

isBasisFor.description: A computational tool which reuses the computational tool

isRelatedTo.description: Computational tools which are related to the given computational tool. These linkages are created via human curation.

isSimilarTo.description: Datasets or computational tools which are similar to the work, based on terms in the names, descriptions, authors, measurementTechniques, infectiousAgents, healthConditions, etc.

topicCategory.description: Topic of the work. This topic may be assigned by a human curator or through automated algorithms.

availableOnDevice.description: Device or platform required to run the application, such as Bioconda, Docker, or Singularity

codeRepository.description: Link to the source code repository of the tool such as GitHub

programmingLanguage.description: The main programming language(s) used to build or execute the tool

input.description: software input, such as a file or parameter

encodingFormat.description: File type of the software input
file type of the tool's output

applicationCategory.description: Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'.

applicationSubCategory.description: Subcategory of the computational tool, like gene regulation

name.description: Subcategory of the tool (ex: gene regulation)
Subcategory of the tool (ex: gene regulation)

applicationSuite.description: The name of the application suite to which the application belongs (e.g. Excel belongs to Office).

downloadUrl.description: URL to download the computational tool

featureList.description: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications).

processorRequirements.description: Processor architecture required to run the application (e.g. IA64).

softwareAddOn.description: Additional content for a software application

softwareHelp.description: URL to access software application help

softwareRequirements.description: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the work. These ratings can be collected based on user reviews or through Altmetric scores of web-based citations.

author.description: Author or creator of the work.

citation.description: A citation or reference to a publication, dataset, or computational tool which uses the computational tool. Examples: a publication which describes the development of the computational tool, a publication which describes the extension or use of the computational tool, a dataset which was processed or analyzed using the tool, or a computational tool which relies on the given tool.

conditionsOfAccess.description: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, the work. Options include open (freely available), restricted (may include restrictions such as on use), closed (requires registration to access), or embargoed (unpublished).

contributor.description: A secondary contributor to the developement or maintenance of the computational tool

creator.description: The creator/author of this work; equivalent to author

datePublished.description: Date the work was first published

discussionUrl.description: A link to a webpage containing the comments about the computational tool.

hasPart.description: An item that is part of this computational tool

inLanguage.description: The language of the computational tool (not programming language)

interactionStatistic.description: The number of interactions with the work, such as page views or tool downloads.

isAccessibleForFree.description: A flag to signal that the work is accessible for free.

isBasedOn.description: A dataset, publication, or computational tool from which this work is derived, modified, or adapted.
isBasedOn.abstract: dataset, publication, or tool used to create the work

isPartOf.description: Indicates a broader study, project, or collection the work is part of.

@graph.rdfs:comment: ResourceCatalogs (collections of scientific information or research outputs) contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. Resource catalogs include databases, repositories, knowledge bases, citation indices, software indices, browser-based data portals (web portals), etc. The NIAID Data Ecosystem is an environment to find and access and infectious and immune-mediated disease data, resources and computational tools to speed the development of diagnostics, therapeutics, and vaccines. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.
@graph.abstract: ResourceCatalogs (collections of scientific information or research outputs) contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. Resource catalogs include databases, repositories, knowledge bases, citation indices, software indices, browser-based data portals (web portals), etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: ResourceCatalog

genre.description: Whether the resource is IID domain specific or generalist.

hasDownload.description: The resource provides downloads of its contents. Options: All content (e.g. entire data builds, tools, etc.), Partial content (just data, or just tools, etc.), Record-level (individual records, or selections of records), no downloads (information is viewable but easily downloaded, users must resort to copy/paste, screenshots, etc.)

propertyvalue.description: A numeric value and unit for a property with potentially different units

value.description: A numeric value for the property

maxValue.description: An estimated maximum numberic value if the actual value is not known. Ignore if actual numeric value is known.

minValue.description: An estimated minumum numeric value if the actual value is not known. Ignore if actual numeric value is known.

unitText.description: A unit associated with the value. E.g.- 'records' for the number of records in a database.

@graph.rdfs:comment: A word, name, acronym, phrase, etc. with a formal definition. Often used in the context of category or subject classification, glossaries or dictionaries, product or creative work types, etc. Use the name property for the term being defined, use termCode if the term has an alpha-numeric code allocated, use description to provide the definition of the term.
@graph.rdfs:label: DefinedTerm

identifier.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

curatedBy.description: The person, organization, or catalog that curated this DefinedTerm for the metadata property

termCode.description: A code that identifies this DefinedTerm within a DefinedTermSet.

inDefinedTermSet.description: A DefinedTermSet that contains this term.

originalName.description: The original name of the item, before any metadata standardization/normalization

isCurated.description: A boolean indicator describing whether or not this DefinedTerm was curated as the value of a property.

name.description: Data, resource or tool catalog name

url.description: Link to data, resource or tool catalog

versionDate.description: date the metadata was harvested from the catalog

name.description: Name of the affiliation, such as a university

parentOrganization.description: Name of the parent organization. For instance, the parentOrganization of NIAID is the National Institutes of health (NIH)

identifier.description: Unique identifier of the organization

role.description: What role the organization played in creating the dataset

name.description: Name of the affiliation, such as a university

identifier.description: Unique identifier of the person, like an ORCID ID

role.description: Role the person played in creating the resource catalog

url.description: Link to the homepage or other web content describing the person

@graph.rdfs:comment: Publications that cite the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool
@graph.rdfs:label: citedBy

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool has changed: most recent date of dateModified, datePublished, and dateCreated.
@graph.rdfs:label: date

@graph.rdfs:comment: Digital object identifier (DOI) for the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool
@graph.rdfs:label: doi

@graph.rdfs:comment: Repository or source which contains the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool
@graph.rdfs:label: includedInDataCatalog

@graph.rdfs:comment: Dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool which incorporate this dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool
@graph.rdfs:label: isBasisFor

@graph.rdfs:comment: Dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool which are related to the given dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool
@graph.rdfs:label: isRelatedTo

@graph.rdfs:comment: Dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool which are similar to the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool, based on terms in the names, descriptions, authors, measurementTechniques, infectiousAgents, healthConditions, etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: isSimilarTo

@graph.rdfs:comment: ClinicalTrials.gov identifier associated with the Dataset
@graph.rdfs:label: nctid

@graph.rdfs:comment: How an associated work is related to the dataset, resource/resource catalog
@graph.rdfs:label: relationship

@graph.rdfs:comment: Topic of the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool. This topic may be assigned by a human curator or through automated algorithms.
@graph.rdfs:label: topicCategory

@graph.rdfs:comment: The type of resource/resource catalog that best describes the work.
@graph.rdfs:label: collectionType

@graph.rdfs:comment: The number of records, datasets, tools, items, pages, etc. in the resource/resource catalog
@graph.rdfs:label: collectionSize

@graph.rdfs:comment: The resource/resource catalog provides download access to its content. Options: All content (e.g. entire data builds, tools, etc.), Partial content (just data, or just tools, etc.), Record-level (individual records, or selections of records), no downloads (information is viewable but easily downloaded, users must resort to copy/paste, screenshots, etc.)
@graph.rdfs:label: hasDownload

@graph.rdfs:comment: The resource/resource catalog provides API access to its content.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasAPI

@graph.rdfs:comment: Infectious agent(s) / pathogen(s) which are the focus of the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool (e.g. SARS-CoV-2)
@graph.rdfs:label: infectiousAgent

@graph.rdfs:comment: The infectious disease(s) / health condition(s) which are the focus of the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool (e.g. COVID-19, coronavirus)
@graph.rdfs:label: healthCondition

@graph.rdfs:comment: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of a dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool through some kind of financial contribution
@graph.rdfs:label: funding

@graph.rdfs:comment: A downloadable form of the dataset, resource/resource catalog, at a specific location, in a specific format.
@graph.rdfs:label: distribution

@graph.rdfs:comment: Species(es) from which dataset has been collected, or is the focus of a resource/resource catalog, or for which the tool was designed or applied.
@graph.rdfs:label: species

@graph.rdfs:comment: A technique, method or technology used in an Observation, StatisticalVariable or Dataset (or DataDownload, DataCatalog), corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (for datasets, described using variableMeasured; for Observation, a StatisticalVariable). For example, if variableMeasured is: molecule concentration, measurementTechnique could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence". If the variableMeasured is "depression rating", the measurementTechnique could be "Zung Scale" or "HAM-D" or "Beck Depression Inventory".
@graph.rdfs:label: measurementTechnique

@graph.rdfs:comment: The variableMeasured property can indicate (repeated as necessary) the variables that are measured in some dataset, either described as text or as pairs of identifier and description using PropertyValue, or more explicitly as a StatisticalVariable.
@graph.rdfs:label: variableMeasured

@graph.rdfs:comment: The curator who generated the metadata annotation.
@graph.rdfs:label: curatedBy

@graph.rdfs:comment: The original name or term that was provided in the metadata.
@graph.rdfs:label: originalName

@graph.rdfs:comment: A boolean indicating whether or not a Defined Term was curated by an annotator (true) or programmatically generated (false).
@graph.rdfs:label: isCurated
